identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

abstract.p: Police say they believe 11-year-old boy fatally stabbed Willie Koonce, boyfriend of boy's mother, because he was beating her in their Brooklyn apartment; boy has not been arrested (S)

block.p: The police said last night that they believed an 11-year-old boy fatally stabbed a man who was beating his mother in their Brooklyn apartment.

The man, Willie Koonce, 37, died after his heart was punctured with a kitchen knife at 7:55 last night at 701 Ralph Avenue in the Brownsville section, Detective Joseph Pentangelo, a police spokesman, said. Mr. Koonce had been beating his long-time girlfriend around the apartment while the boy watched, the police said.
The police said last night that they believed an 11-year-old boy fatally stabbed a man who was beating his mother in their Brooklyn apartment.

The man, Willie Koonce, 37, died after his heart was punctured with a kitchen knife at 7:55 last night at 701 Ralph Avenue in the Brownsville section, Detective Joseph Pentangelo, a police spokesman, said. Mr. Koonce had been beating his long-time girlfriend around the apartment while the boy watched, the police said.

The boy, whose name was not released, was being questioned last night in the 73d Precinct. Authorities said they believed he pulled a knife from the kitchen drawer to protect his mother from Mr. Koonce.
Mr. Koonce was taken to Brookdale Hospital were he died at 8:30 P.M., a hospital spokesman said.
The police had not arrested the boy as of this morning.

A neighbor said that she was not surprised. ''There was always terrible commotion in that place,'' said the woman who would only give her name as Ms. Cox. ''That man was always threatening those poor people.''
